Description: Plastic double head of Chian, probably black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel, perhaps a handle from a domed lid; white slip; two female heads with black hair back to back, each with painted facial features and dotted necklace with three pendants; hollow inside with hole at the top; below, two brown lines, then traces of slanting lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ157
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA110.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1383)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2167) (phase 2)
